title: Apple Encourages Students to Learn Coding with Swift Student Challenge and "Everyone Can Code" Projects
originSummary: Apple has launched the Swift Student Challenge, a competition to motivate young developers to learn coding using the Swift programming language.
Apple has also introduced four new projects as part of its "Everyone Can Code" initiative to help students develop their app development skills.

These initiatives aim to provide resources and support for students to learn coding and create innovative solutions to real-world problems, offering opportunities for various careers and making a positive impact in different fields.

title: Apple Recognizes Innovative Student Coders with Swift Student Challenge and "Everyone Can Code" Projects
originSummary: Apple has introduced new initiatives to support student learning in coding and app development.
The Swift Student Challenge will be available in 2024, giving students the opportunity to showcase their coding skills.
Apple has also launched four new "Everyone Can Code" projects, which were announced at a coding workshop for STEAM Day.

title: Apple Engineers Choose Python as Top Programming Language for 2024
originSummary: Python is the most popular programming language at Apple, followed by C++, Java, Objective-C, Swift, Perl, and JavaScript.
Python's popularity has increased, especially in specialized areas like machine learning.
Apple emphasizes the importance of knowing its in-house languages, Swift and Objective-C, but also values JavaScript, Java, and C++ for job opportunities at Apple and elsewhere.
